pr_title: LUCENE-9350: Don't hold references to large automata on FuzzyQuery

timeline.bodyText: Why not implement these like they are done on 8x?  I suspect introspection tools like "luke" / Solr analysis page may choke if this isn't done right.
timeline.author: dsmiley

replies.bodyText: It's a private implementation and only gets used internally to FuzzyTermsEnum, so I don't see how the analysis page or luke would get presented with one of these?
replies.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: nitpick: compare the term first, as it is most likely to return false for different fuzzy
timeline.author: dsmiley

replies.bodyText: Is there a school of thought that we want to compare most likely to differ objects first, competing with the school that advocates comparing primitive types first because they are faster?
replies.author: madrob

timeline.bodyText: I'm confused about the difference between when we would want the full automaton set and when we want the max edit automaton. When is one useful but not the other? Is this a simple optimization to skip building the relatively inexpensive (exponentially less expensive, even) fewer edit automata?
timeline.author: madrob

replies.bodyText: Just the max is useful for highlighting or for other fuzzy searches that don't do the TopTerms pruning (we use it for a fuzzy interval query in elasticsearch, for example)
replies.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: Does this still build the automata each time?
timeline.author: madrob

replies.bodyText: Only if the visitor implementation actually needs it, we're passing a Supplier now.
replies.author: romseygeek

timeline.bodyText: The java doc on this suggest that we need to be using an AttributeFactory, but that might be overkill here?
timeline.author: madrob

replies.bodyText: I don't think we can use an AttributeFactory here because the attribute source has already been created.  This seems to work fine though - @thetaphi can probably tell me if I've done something wrong?
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: Uh. You sure you tagged the right sentient here? xD
replies.author: thetaphi

replies.bodyText: I think that's fine here. There is only one implementation that's all internally used.
replies.author: uschindler

timeline.bodyText: why not getAttribute? If we're sharing this across segments, then I think we want to reuse the same one each time, right?
timeline.author: madrob

replies.bodyText: addAttribute will return the already existing attribute if it's there, but create one if it isn't.  getAttribute won't work here because it won't do the create part.
replies.author: romseygeek

replies.bodyText: GetAttribute is also fine, because you added the impl a line before. If the attribute wouldn't be there, adding it won't work, because it's all private. So all: That's just a matter of preference. I'd check how we do this at other places.
replies.author: uschindler

timeline.bodyText: do we need to update the java docs on multi term query to reflect that fuzzy query also uses the attribute source now as well?
timeline.author: madrob
